Reviews.Title: “Not great, but free parking, and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: I didn't have a wonderful time here, but there was nothing wrong with the room. It was clean and fairly quiet; it had a nice kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “totally disgusting”
Reviews.Author: halibutsam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked in at the Riviera on Thursday, October 20 and had planed to stay for two nights. After we saw the awful state of the suite, we asked for a refund, but were denied. I went to the front desk, armed with my camera, and explained that I would put photos of the suite on the internet, we were given a refund without a problem. There was mold on the ceiling in the hall, in the bedroom, in the bathroom, and the living room. The windows had no screens. Wallpaper in the living room was curling up above the heater, which was falling apart. An electrical cord above the heater was stapled three times to the wall. The chesterfield appeared very old. The carpet was old, dirty and worn; it curled up at several places in the suite. The suite was a mess, totally disgusting. We checked out and moved to another, much better hotel for a little extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: michelw88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this apartment in September for a total duration of three nights. In general we liked the place, but it had a few downsides as well. Pros: - Location: only 6 blocks from the train that takes you to YVR airport. It is centrally located, with downtown Vancouver, grocery stores (Safeway and Whole Foods), restaurants, internet cafés, Stanley Park, bicycle rental places etc. all located within walking distance - Spacious apartment. - Beautiful view of the city and the mountains. We had asked for a room with a view to the north on a higher floor, and got one, which gave beautiful views both at day and at night. The balcony is a nice extra. - The price: it was the cheapest hotel in the downtown area, plus because it has a kitchen, we saved even more money by not having to eat out every night, as Vancouver is an expensive city. - Despite being in downtown Vancouver, it was quiet in the apartment. Cons: - The hotel seemed like it had been renovated a few years ago (maybe for the Olympics?), and since then not much has been done for maintenance. For example the ‘Hotel’-sign only had ‘Ho’ lit up at night, there were stains in the curtains, the kitchen was not very clean (we had to do dishes before we were able to use them, as there was still dirt from previous users on them), the elevator did not respond to ‘door close’, etc. Nothing was in an unacceptable condition, also we didn’t see any bugs, but I wonder whether the hotel would get the 3.5 star rating as it has been rated by if it would be rated nowadays. - The hotel room was pretty cold. When we asked the receptionist, we got a space heater, but that only helped a little. In general we had a pleasant stay at the hotel, and some of the comments here on Tripadvisor we could not relate to at all: for example the windows did have shades (7th floor) even during the day it was pretty dark in the room. The staff was friendly and helpful, the bed was comfortable, we got warm water in the shower instantly etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great option if street noise doesnt bother you”
Reviews.Author: desktopdreamer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at riviera for two nights after flying in from southeast Asia. The price is great and the location is ideal. We were given a room on 9th floor (2nd from top) and you could hear everything going on on street level down below. We were too tired to care and slept right thru but if we hadn't been so tired we might have had to go out and buy earplugs. Very clean and daily servicing even thought it's a one bedroom apt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: daveKamloops
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night ,and was very pleased.It was by far the cheapest hotel in the city centre,and also included free parking and WIFI, The location is perfect on Robson Street halfway between all the shopping,and Stanley Park.Very safe location.The furnishings are tired but overall the suite was clean and functional.Also bonus balcony over looking all the action on Robson,and view of English Bay. $99 for a one bedroom with full kitchen including parking and wifi "what a deal:

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: morfarToronto
Reviews.Content: When ever we visit Vancouver we always stay at the Riviera, which is a relaxed small suite hotel on Robson Street, down town. The location is great, one can walk almost everywhere a visitor to Vancouver would be interested in visiting, including Stanley Park. The rooms are spacious and clean, the furnishing might seem a little tired to some.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here, dishonest staff”
Reviews.Author: Ranj0
Reviews.Content: When my boyfriend and I stayed here after a wedding, I accidentally left my bridesmaid dress in the bathroom. I finally realized the next day and was suprised they never called to tell me. When I called, I was told it was thrown out! They said to call back the next day and when I did they said I was lucky the garbage hadn't gone out, so it was there. When i picked it up I asked them if they found a laptop or wallet full of cash they would throw it out and they said yes. Wow, thats a great way to run a business.....

Reviews.Title: “Should be rated higher”
Reviews.Author: rdcjMD
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in this hotel. I took my chances inspite of the lower rating because I've stayed in this area before and I was extremely happy with my decision. First of all the reception staff were all fantastic and friendy. They really get out of your way to make your stay enjoyable. The rooms were always cleaned. They may be slightly dated as written in previous reviews but they serve their purpose..comfortable and functional especially with the complete kitchen. Location? Read all the reviews!! They are all correct. For $ 99 a day, I hit the jackpot. Thank you Riviera and the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!!!!! Completely bad!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Browni67
Reviews.Content: Where do we start? Run down building outside and inside. Smells, hide a bed with thin mattress so sleeping on springs. Cigarette burns all over blankets. Electical tape around the hair dryer. Lamps that had shorts in them. Shower water that took 15 minutes to get warm. No mat for shower that was slopped. No screens on the windows 8 stories up. Laundry facility still had wet towels and comforter inside 2 washers left by housekeeping. Dirty dirty! Smelled so bad near the entry of the parking garage. All through the night heard traffic outside. Scary squeak in the elevator which takes forever! They need to just tear the building down and start over!!!!!! We checked out the next am as soon asap. They didn't blink a eye or charge us when we said we were leaving. Must be used to one night stays!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: maxine6
Reviews.Content: This is a good value budget hotel, clean, excellent location, full kitchen, and mostly helpful staff. Ther is a Italian cafe close by that's serves good pasta.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money & great location”
Reviews.Author: ozcanoz
Reviews.Content: I had cause to stay here twice over the summer - a week before we went on an Alaska trip and a week upon my return. Both my travel friend (from Germany) and myself (from Australia) found it to be clean and comfortable. All comments about the attitude of front desk staff were correct - except that when I started asking him about HIS day had been, suddenly the abuptness turned into helpfulness and a welcoming smile whenever we came through the front door. The summer past was fantastic weather so air con would have been nice, but with a balcony and windows in both the bedroom and living /dining areas there was always a breeze you could shift a chair to catch. As noted by others the furnishings are old, but nothing was broken in either of the suites we used. The free internet connection in the room was very welcome. The rooms were kept very clean (although like others we had long waits for the rooms to be ready) and the cleaning staff were very helpful with proving an extra towel or tea towel. Location is perfect - especially for walkers. But with a bus stop meters from the door, and the frequent service it was a good location for everyone. And Vancouver buses are accessible, courteous and even in the pre-Olympics building diversions safe & convenient. This hotel and the self catering kitchen and ample cheap take-aways nearby (sushi, fish & chips, Korean, Chinese, Greek) made it a very reasonable stay. Starbucks and Blenz are close as are Safeway & a gourmet market (name?) by Whole Foods. One note on laundry - it was often not available until late afternoon as the cleaning staff are using it to do the sheets and towels as they clean. I found a laundrromat down on Denman Street about 2 1/2 blocks from Robson - up on the first floor that was cheaper and available from very early until very late, and a bit cheaper overall. They have heaps of machines so not much (if any) waiting. I plan on staying at the Riveria again in 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional Mgmt,”
Reviews.Author: meh98
Reviews.Content: The first and the last time I will consider Riviera Hotel in Vancouver for business trip or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible welcome, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cocobonbon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Riviera Hotel for 2 nights in mid September. Since it was our first time in Canada, I mailed the hotel directly to ask for directions to the hotel from the Amtrak train station- the Pacific Central Station. And, I got no replies. I managed to get there, luckily, hopping on the Bus #5, which dropped us off, about 10 steps away from the hotel. So, I got there safely, but tired from the trip. And an unpleasant welcome at the reception desk was the last thing I needed. A man was checking-in before me, so I waited for my turn, while the man listened to the Spanish? hotel guy complain about whatever he was having problems with. When it was finally my turn, I smiled and said hi, but all I got in return was a frown and a quick 'hi'. Unlike the friendliness the man before me got, I was just given a room key on the counter, and he said," Room 704. Bye." Maybe he was having a bad day, but I sure didn't deserve that attitude as a guest... But putting all those behind, we went to our room, hoping to hop on the bed to stretch and relax. We open our room door and enter, only to find the bed a whole mess with lots of hair from the visitor before us. We check the bathroom, only to find disappointment and disgust that the sink is filled with hair, and the towels all over the bathroom floor. There was a cup on the kitchen counter- obviously used. Garbage was found here and there on the carpeted living room as well. I hurried down to the guy to tell him that he gave us the wrong room- its a mess!! In reply, he looks up at me, no smile, no expression, and said, "Check-in is at 4. Room is probably not ready yet. Just leave your things in the room, no problem." and goes back to his computer, as if the dirty room was normal. If he gave us the room to be nice before check-in time, thank you. But he could've at least told us that the room is not made yet, but we can leave our belongings in the room. Just a simple short sentence to prepare us for what we're going to see.. When we re-entered the room after 4, we found the room tidy, bed made, and towels changed. But after all that, nothing felt clean anymore. Not to mention that the towel still had some hair on it, and it was a well-used towel. Nothing like the crisp, fresh, clean towels you get at hotels. The garbage was still on the floor, right where I found them in the beginning, and the used cup was still on the kitchen counter, also where I've last seen it. Had it not been for the Capers/ Wholefoods store just a block and a half away, the fully-equipped kitchen, and being in the center of everything, we probably would have left. Our stay comes with more surprises, when our swipe card key to our room apparently 'expired' on the second day, although I reserved to stay at the hotel for 2 nights. Luckily, we didn't have to change rooms, but did we feel very welcomed...The room was made the second night, towels changed, but the sheets weren't changed- just made it look tidy. To use the laundry, we have to receive another swipe card to get into the laundry room- be prepared with lots of quarters! At check-out, we were about to complain about our stay, only to find the same guy that checked us in! And he was nasty to me all the way till the end. He told me to sign, but as I was checking the hotel fee, it was higher than what I booked it for. I got out my print-out, and started to check the breakdown, when he said, "Just sign it, ok". That got more suspicious, and I found out the my rate for the first night was higher. When confronted, he got really angry, and circled the hotel rate, underlined the tax for the ngiht, and slammed the pen down on the counter. Angrily, he told me to complain to the government if I had complaints, and that everyone has to pay taxes. Duh, like I don't know anything about taxes. I was talking about the actual room rate, but he kept on telling me to go complain to the government. Besides these, all other hotel staff were helpful, and very friendly. Location was excellent- Bus#5 runs down Robson frequently, internet cafes 2 doors down, and a block away, Bus#19 that takes you into Stanley park is 2 blocks down behidn the hotel, safe area with people walking outside at night as well, lots of places to eat and grab a coffee in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: HertsTraveller081
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early August after recommendations from a friend who lives in Vancouver (and is a Lonely Planet author as well) and was very impressed with it. It's in an excellent location on Robson Street, the centre of Vancouver is around a 10 minute walk away, as is the beach. It's also opposite a bus-stop for the Airporter service to Vancouver airport. The room(s) were spacious and clean, with a good kitchen and dining area - although you are so close to so many great-value restaurants in Denman Street (I recommend the Olympic Greek restaurant and the fish and chip shop on Denman) you don't need to use it if you don't want to. There is also free car-parking. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and it all contributed to an enjoyable stay. The only minor quibble could be the lack of air-con in the rooms. Having a window open could be noisy, so try and get on as high a floor as possible and not facing onto Robson, but other than that it is thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: nega
Reviews.Content: We had no idea about the condition of this place, and it was paid for by a relative who said he had stayed there some time ago, which was probably in the 70's. The location was the only good point, as we could walk to many of Vancouver's wonderful sites. The minuses have been pointed out by other reviewers, the carpet in the room was recked, there was of course no air conditioning so the windows had to be opened but then closed because of all the foot traffic during the night. We were given a wonderful welcome to Vancouver two mornings in a row by the Fire Brigade and Ambulance with their very loud sirens. Most of the furniture was broken and there were cigarette burns on on the tv and in the bathroom on the sink, toilet etc. We were given a room only just up from street level with the lovely neon sign just outside. We asked to be moved, but they said they were fully booked. I really can't understand why, but perhaps as it is a BUDGET motel it appeals to some people. I would not recommend this motel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: osdoerr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May and had really great weather for 4 days..temps in the mid 70's or 24 Celsius....that brought about the only problem we had with the hotel...noise from the outside. As the hotel has no air conditioning and the windows are not double paned, we had to leave the windows open. It took quite a while 'til things on busy Robson ST. quieted down...plus the air in the room was a little sticky....As for the roo itself, it was just as how others in this forum described: A spot on the carpet here, a dink in the cabinet there...but generally quite clean and we had a nice partial view of the harbour. But the biggest plus for this hotel is the location! Fantastic at the end of Robson with restaurants galore around you and close proximity to everything!! and a really great neighborhood to boot!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: let me start with the ouside of the hotel, it looks like its going to fall down any day. The inside just got worse! The carpets were disgustingly dirty and the walls and lamps had stains all over them. The noise was horrible young kids were having a party across the hall and kept us up all night. The shower was ok clean enough but all and all it was a terrible stay we checked out at 8:00 am as soon as we got up.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for May long weekend and had a good time. We got a harbor view room with kitchen. The whole expanse of room in 6th floor was with glass on one side , so view was good. The Hotel does not look posh from outisde and is right on Robson st but is decent PROS- large room with kitchen in the suite good view from 6th floor budget rate - I think we paid about 100$ per night for a room with kitchen !!! CONS - no microwave in the room. there is one in lobby which we used it since we needed it for our 3 year old. they said they plan to add microwave next year. We had to heat it in stove for everything. it is close to everything - very close to stanley park and did most of sighseeing in vancouver by rental car in a day

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise With a Great View!”
Reviews.Author: PedroMilton
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Robson Street, this serene tower offers you a lot more than it's first glance. Its initial lobby is quaint, but comfortable. We sat and watched the TV for about an hour. The elevator is small, but an excellent entrance for the main attraction -- the room. Our room was not a room, it was an apartment. It was larger than our 1 bedroom in NYC. It had a view of sea planes heading to Victoria. The windows are large for the sun that is rare, but brilliant. The style is country living, very functional, family oriented with a touch of real world -- basically, very comfortable. Please note this is not the Ritz, but if you don't have the dough it is a decent option.

Reviews.Title: “Homophobes”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers a choice of either a king-sized bed in a suite or a room with two queen-sized beds. I reserved a suite in advance. When we arrived, the man and woman behind the desk sized us up (Queers!) and offered us a room with two beds. I said no thank you. He and his wife had a discussion in a language I don't understand. He had my reservation in hand with a 7th floor room number but he scratched that off and gave me a key to a room on the third floor. This room had two beds and a window next to their very large hotel sign. We had to argue with the front desk before getting the room that was originally reserved for us. This was two years ago. It makes no sense that anyone who has troubles with gays would work or own property on Robson Street but we live in a strange world.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: sargeatwork
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riviera Hotel for 6 days end of May 2004. Rooms need to be spruced up as they are looking pretty dated and bed was not comfortable at all. That being said, the room was adequate with a great little kitchenette allowing us to eat breakfast in each morning. Above all, the location of this moderately priced hotel can't be beat! On Robson St which has lots of activity, great shopping, transportation, etc. Within walking distance to Stanley Park, Denman St, Burrard St. and the waterfront. Prety good value!

Reviews.Title: “great location and value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A modestly priced hotel with a great location. Friendly and helpful staff. Rooms need freshening but for the price it's great.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE of the neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in August 2003 during a warm spell in Vancouver. NO air-conditioning at all so the windows had to remain open. Our room faced Robson Street which is very busy with a great deal of traffic 24 hours a day. We asked to move, but were denied. Hence sleeping was a challenage with all the noise. The hotel is next to a vacant lot that attracts many homeless folks. Though we parked our vehicle in their "secure" parking garage, it was broken into and we lost a bicycle and suffered a smashed in window. Their own staff admitted a large crime problem around their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning of September 2003. It was warm in Vancouver then. To our surprise, there is no airconditioner in the rooms. If you decide to stay here, you must be comfortable sleeping with the windows wide open at night. Our room was facing Robson Street, a very busy street. It was quite noisy in the room with the sound of cars and buses passing by and car alarms going off specially with the window and sliding door open. The bathroom looks newly remodelled with cheap fixtures. The room needs a major overhaul. The room is spacious. We had a one bedroom suite but I would not call it a suite. The furniture, sofabed and bed needs replacing. Looks like they were acquired in the 1970's. The old curtains had a tear, the thin bedsheet also was torn and had a big hole. There is a kitchenette with a refrigerator, stove/oven and dishes. No microwave! The hotel did not provide paper towels for us to use, just 2 dish towels. We used the dishes for breakfast and left them on the sink. To our amazement, the maid did not wash them. However, what they did was place the dish soap, dirty sponge that looks like it was used to clean car tires next to the sink. The carpet also needs changing but the linoleum in the kitchen looks fairly new. The elevator can fit only 4 people. This should give you an idea of how small the elevator is. Each floor only had 4 or 5 rooms (I cannot remember now). The lobby looks ok and clean. The hotel manager was nice and friendly. Lastly, if you plan on leaving your luggage for storage after check-out, they charge $2 CAD per luggage as storage fee. Overall, I would personally not stay here again. The room rate we were charged was too much for the type of accomodation we received. Also, although this hotel is located along Robson, it is a very long walk to the main shopping district. Be ready to take a bus or a cab to get to downtown.
